ratings.comment: John was an amazing professor, probably one of the best I've had. He's very kind, funny, and genuinely wants students to succeed. He was apparently assigned to teach 301 with a new textbook very last minute and hadn't taught it in 10 years, but I still thought he did a great job. The class wasn't too difficult as long as you put in the effort.

John had some fun anecdotes that made lecture enjoyable especially with it being an 8 am. He provided fill-in-the-blank notes which was helpful. Sometimes, the exams did not match what was taught which was frustrating. However, the final was a piece of cake. Homework was manageable- with a peer. Quizzes were similar to homework, slightly easier.

John's course material is very well organized, and you learn useful skills for a future career in basically any quantitative field. He cares a lot about students, both with learning course material and with personal goals and professional development. If you're struggling, ask for help during office hours!

John genuinely cares about his students' success and creates a supportive, approachable learning environment. The course itself is very practical, with numerous industrial-relevant examples that help make complex machine learning concepts easier to grasp. Definitely a highly valuable and insightful course.

John is probably the best lecturer I ever had. And he is good at giving step-by-step instructions to guide students through the processes. He is also very helpful during office hours.
However, he gave heavy&hard hw, with tight&strict ddl. Even though I had flexible deadline accommodation, he was unwilling to give extensions (eventually he did).

Honestly, haven't gotten my final grade back but a very fair teacher. If you put in effort and work hard it will pay off which can't be said about every class and every professor. He always clarifies and is always happy to help people if they need it.

John was very kind and approachable, and cared about students' success. He lead review sessions before exams and was thorough in answering questions. He even scheduled a review session on his day off before the final just so we would feel more prepared. Also, I needed to reschedule one of my exams and he was very accommodating in doing so.

Professor Gillett is a lovely man! I got fed up with the mediocre TA's for 371 this summer so I went to his office hours and he was really great. He answered all my questions very well. I put off this course for 3 years out of dread but actually really enjoyed it! He is a good professor to take any course with.
He's super genuine. Very clear in his work and while he does get confused sometimes its not from lack of effort, and he always makes sure to clarify when he understands.

Took this course during the 3 week summer term and very much enjoyed it. Professor Gillett set up the course well and made sure that in an online setting everyone could still get feedback and help when needed. He clearly knew a lot about the subject and wanted to help his students learn about the applications of R.

Recorded lectures that are difficult to hear him in; available via Piazza for questions; hands-off grader; sometimes difficult to replicate examples in different contexts so he could explain some details more; 8 quizzes with 4 HWs and 1 exam.

Professor Gillett, is a nice guy and a solid lecturer (although he tends to talk quite fast). He does a good job of providing examples for each concept. However, the content of his lectures and homework do not always match what he tests, so it does feel like he doesn't explain all material thoroughly. What he does go over, he explains quite well.

Really nice guy, go to office hours if confused. Tests are hard. Lectures are recorded. Make sure you know how to solve problems by hand and with R for the exams because both questions will come up. Understand lecture notes because tests ask conceptual questions as well as word problems. Overall, good teacher, but hard class.

Prof. Gillett is one of the best teachers I've had. However, his tests were difficult and I felt somewhat unable to prepare well even after attending office hours (I also tried attending the TA's office hours but he came across as both arrogant and fake, and worst of all not qualified enough to provide much help with the harder questions).

Prof. John provided very inspirational lectures with great demonstrations. His homework was also highly relevant to his teaching. The exams were kind of hard, but if you tried your best for the homework and group project, your overall grade should be okay.

Professor Gillett is an amazing teacher and overall great man. His lectures are very organized and he explains difficult concepts very well. He also provides fill-in-the-blank notes which I personally like. He loves to tell funny stories and really encourages students to ask questions. Tests were extremely difficult, study hard to succeed!

John Gillett is one of the best professors I have taken a class from. His lectures are clear and he does not overcomplicate concepts. He told plenty of jokes and stories during power lectures to help make them easier to sit through. His exams are online with a generous time window and are very fair. Would absolutely recommend

Prof. Gillett was a top-notch intro stats professor, not much more to say. Never took AP Stats in HS but he explained the concepts super well and made class interesting and enjoyable. Topics were hard and required thought but he helped me to understand them well:the tests were easy as a result. I'd strongly recommend him for any intro stats course.

I would say STAT 479 is not a difficult course if you are familiar with Linux commands, but few of us know it very well. John is passionate, but I have to admit that his lectures are fast, and there are really lots of things to learn. He is patient during office hours, but just get prepared to spend some time on the materials at home

He is the most awful stat professor. He seems nice but he is not reasonable when it comes to homework timeline, homework and projects are very hectic at the end and it got so rough. The computation steps learnt in the course takes hours to run and hard to debug. He do not reply your emails before homework deadlines. Very unpleasant experience

Professor Gillett is fantastic! He did a great job teaching STAT 451, and although there were a few bumps along the way, he overall did a great job. Very caring, fair, and interesting lecturer! I would. highly recommend.

He is a great professor, but in this class that there is too much work that you need to learn on your own. He keeps on telling you about how to use Linux or remote machines. But the teaching process is too fast.
And he also uses his keyboard to finish many processes while doesn't tell us what he has done on his keyboard which makes it even harder.
LOVED John. I took Stat 303/304 with him and even having minimal CS experience, I found his lectures very helpful.

He explains concepts pretty throughly and uploaded lecture material pretty quickly for students that couldnt attend. He tells a lot of stories and jokes during class which helps draw attention back to him during power lectures.

John was a great Prof., gives lecture notes for each unit that are easy to follow, and lays out the material really well. There is a decent amount of work that goes along with the class but as long as you show up to lecture it's an easy A.

Best Stats371 professor at this school! Even if you have to rearrange your schedule to take him it is 100% worth it! He was amazing at explaining concepts and would break power lectures up by telling us fun stories about his family, which was my always so much appreciated. His note sheets were so helpful and I still reference them
Lots of work but if you're proactive, Dr. Gillett is very willing to answer questions and assist.

His practice exams mimicked his exams. He essentially covered one new topic a day, but I've heard the class is only easy if the topic immediately clicked with you. He's a very nice teacher, with fun stories to tell anytime he gets bored or stressed. You learn "R" for coding, which can be hard, but TA's will help with any problems you find with it.

John is by far the most genuine professor I've had. He cares about his students a great deal and is always looking for feedback to improve his class. His tests are extremely fair, some problems even coming from the practice exams. Not too much work, although concepts can be difficult if you're not math inclined. Cannot recommend this guy enough.

His online class for STAT 303 is super accessible and easy in the right ways. He explains things pretty well in his videos (sorted by individual sections of his notes rather than having a 55-minute video with no breaks) and lets students retake quizzes as many times as they need with additional questions available for practice.

John cares about his students and is accessible for support. Can be disorganized but conveys material well. Tests get progressively harder so study for the first one! He uses typed/fill in the blank note sheets to guide lectures. PRINT THEM & USE THEM otherwise you won't keep up in lecture! Transitioned well to online class, great communication!!

John is a great professor! His notes are fill in the blank, and he explains concepts clearly. Sometimes he goes kind of fast in lecture, but he is easily accessible in office hours. Overall, he's genuinely a nice guy who cares about the success of his students.

Pretty bad teacher. Goes extremely fast, too fast to follow if your new to statistics. Goes even faster since all his lectures follow hand outs that he has for each unit. Tests got progressively harder, and account for most of your grade. He was a nice guy and funny to, just not a good teacher, and tests make up most of the grade

Professor Gillett was one of the best profs I've had at UW. Very caring and funny, always would ask the class if it was okay to interrupt lecture with a quick random story about one of his kids. Only criticism I have of the class was that almost all of the exam questions are graded w/ no partial credit, which can get annoying. Loved John though.

He is really nice and really cares that his students understand the material. He's also hilarious and makes power lectures not as boring. He does not post notes so you have to go to lecture. Practice exams really help and he gives you an entire piece of paper for notes for exams. And you can use all 3 pages of notes on the final from previous exams

One of the best profs Ive had in college, made a boring lecture heavy class fun with his sense of humor. Gives good examples of topics and explains them well. Do all the example problems and all the homework (which theres not a lot of) and this class will be easy.

John Gillett is an outstanding guy. I really don't like math, but I kept going to class just because I liked him so much personally. He's very down-to-earth and approachable. Also math classes don't get much easier than this. If you make a good note sheet (you get a full piece of paper for each test), you will do very well on the exams.

Ive never taken a stats class before, and I was easily getting 90s on the exams. He gives you fill in the blank notes, which makes lecture super easy. He truly doesnt make this class any harder than it has to be. As long as you show up and do the homework, youll know everything you need to know. Hes also very approachable and nice.
He is clearly very good at the subject, but he jumps around a lot and lecture can get confusing. Very easy to get distracted bc his teaching is so all over the place.
One of the best professors I've had at UW. Genuinely cares about students and their success in this class. May not go out of his way to help (as he shouldn't) but is always there to help if needed.

stay away from him un organized does not describe things effectively simply moves on and said "if this makes sense for some of you all good and if it didn't well" he don't care that the majority of people do not understand anything he says

He's a cool dude. As for his class, he's a little disorganized but gives ample material to succeed. Stat371 is by far the easiest stat class from what I've heard and John makes it probably easier than it should be... Not that I'm complaining. Avoid the power lecture if you can just because power lectures suck. Always answers questions on Piazza.

I have Gillett currently for Statistics 371, and I can say he is one of the worst lecturers I have had. He's very disorganized, and doesn't even seem to prepare ahead of time for the class (which is a power lecture). During lecture, he often makes mistakes in his explanation and has to go back and correct himself. Very confusing for me.
Had no experience with R- the homework were graded very hard. The exam was extremely difficult. Recommend getting a tutor if you never had used R.

Super nice guy and very personable. Not too hard of a class and if you have any programing knowledge coming in, R is a breeze.  Otherwise, can be a little difficult. Would definitely recommend. (Took elementary, intermediate, and advanced with him)
He was awesome. Tests are just like practice exam he gives. Discussions are worthless but if you go to lecture you will do well

He has a rare ability to explain complicated concepts extremely well. I wish he could teach my other stats classes, too. This class is pretty easy if you already know how to program, but apparently more difficult if you don't. Grading seems pretty lenient and is based mostly on online quizzes and homework.

John is a great professor and very down to earth. Nice guy, and very willing to help you learn the topics (which are not difficult to begin with). I never went to discussion, they didnt do much for me. Take professor gillett if you can!

Awesome teacher and TA!  Not finsihed with this class yet, but should be expecting an AB or an A.  I'm not good at math at all.  Stop saying this comment was already entered!  That better have solved this problem.

Super nice guy. You just fill in blanks on note sheets each lecture. This was my easiest class of the semester but I got B because I didn't put in much effort. If you want an A, you can get it with ease. Make sure you do the online quizzes cause it will haunt you if you don't.

Gillett is a truly great guy. He's a skilled teacher - making stats so much more engaging than it would otherwise be. He's  also very approachable, and truly interested in helping each student learn. He tells really fun stories and talks about his kids too. I couldn't recommend him highly enough.

He makes notesheets for every lecture, lets you have notesheets for exams...and he even makes those note sheets for you too. He's very friendly, a nice and approachable guy, and is clear in his lectures and conveys the material well. Definitely recommended

Very helpful and straightfoward.  He wants all of his students to learn the material well and cares about how you are performing. He's always willing to help out with assignments and quizzes which makes the class a lot less stressful. Would definitely recommend him if you're looking into any stats classes!

He is just AWESOME and very CHARMING as a man. He often tells interesting stories in class and tries to make class fun. Class work in not hard and managable. Exams are very straighforward and even easier than lecture notes... You will get an A if you work hard. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

He is the best teacher I've had at this school so far. He is a little goony and loves to tell stories, and this keeps the class interesting for a dull class. Exams are very fair and he writes up all the notes and cheat sheets for the exams. Highly recommended!
Great guy, good teacher.  Class was a little dull, but it's stats, what can you expect? Definitely recommend him.

He is incredibly nice and helpful - makes an effort to get to know every single person in my 150+ person lecture by name, is extremely helpful if you go to his office hours, very willing to answer any questions or write letters of recommendation for you, a genuinely great teacher. even prints off the notes every lecture & writes exam formula sheets
This guy is pretty cool, not only did he let us have a formula sheet for exams, he made the formula sheet FOR us. He also prints out the notes for you, you only have to fill in the blanks.

Great Professor, he really makes an effort to get to know you and help you as much a possible. He also tells stories about himself and his life during class which helps keep it interesting. My favorite professor at UW madison by far.
The class was very dull.  The homework can be very repetitive and tedious.  Overall very nice and helpful professor.

Pretty sure he's in the comp sci department, but he taught my stats 224 class.  Excellent prof both in his teaching and grading scale.  Two grading scales (one on normal percentages, the other 30% of students automatically get A's!!!).
